summary: The Nicene Creed is a famous statement of belief in Christianity. It was first written in 325 at a meeting of important religious leaders, called the First Council of Nicaea. The creed says that Christians believe in one God, called God the Father, who created everything. It also talks about Jesus, whom Christians believe is God's son. This creed is used in many Christian churches, especially in the Orthodox and Catholic traditions, to show what they believe. People often say it during important church services.
title: Nicene Creed
